main event: A round, bright red object was observed by a pilot in the sky near Ephrata, Washington in March 1961.
interesting points: The object was about 1/15 the size of the moon and moved rapidly, disappearing in about 7 seconds.
The object appeared stationary at first, then suddenly disappeared at the same spot where it was sighted.
The pilot reported the object was tracked visually, but ground control did not confirm the sighting on radar.
The object was estimated to be moving at around 1,030 knots (over 1,000 mph) by Spokane Center.
The report considered multiple possible explanations including Venus, an aircraft, an astronomical object, or a satellite.
sighted object: a round, bright red object in the sky
